Assuming this means that Tomcat fails to start, I tried extracting the binary
Tomcat 3.2.1 release to "C:\Jakarta Test" and setting TOMCAT_HOME to

If this doesn't cover your situation, re-open the bug and please provide enough

creator: olaf.jahn@zamioculcas.net
text:
I have to reopen this bug: Tomcat 3.3a cannot deal with spaces

in e.g. TOMCAT_HOME. This applies at least to Unix, where startup.sh

contains lots of references to ${TOMCAT_HOME} without making sure

that paths contructed with it do not get torn apart by the shell.

Example



Line 170 of startup.sh:

echo $JAVA_PID > ${TOMCAT_HOME}/logs/tomcat.pid

Gives the error message 

  .../tomcat/bin/tomcat.sh:${TOMCAT_HOME}/logs/tomcat.pid: ambiguous redirect



Line 165

$JAVACMD $TOMCAT_OPTS -Dtomcat.home=${TOMCAT_HOME}  $MAIN start $@ &

sets a wrong value for tomcat.home. Plus, if JAVA_HOME contains

a space, cannot even start the command.



The propably applies to TOMCAT_INSTALL and paths contained within TOMCAT_OPTS.



I haven't examined tomcat.bat and the other files yet, but I suspect a 

similar problem. 



On the other hand, jk_nt_service.exe works like a charm if

paths are properly quoted in the wrapper.properties.



This problem makes the inclusion of Tomcat into a larger 

project difficult because it places a contraint on the directory

where it can be deployed later.
